etymology.description: 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") + 隹(隹) (zhuī, "short-tailed bird") = phonetic element 隹 with semantic element 口 for voice -> meaning of 'only'
etymology.interpretation: The character 唯(wéi) combines 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") indicating speech or vocal expression, with 隹(隹) (zhuī, "short-tailed bird") which serves as a phonetic component. The combination suggests making a singular statement, hence 'only'.

examples.chinese: 唯有努力(唯有努力)，才能成功(才能成功)。
examples.pinyin: Wéi yǒu nǔlì, cái néng chénggōng.
examples.english: Only through hard work can one succeed.

examples.chinese: 他是唯一选择(他是唯一選擇)。
那台电脑是全场里唯一款性能最强的(那台電腦是全場裡唯一款性能最強的)。
examples.pinyin: Nà tái diànnǎo shì quánchǎng lǐ wéiyī kuǎn xìngnéng zuì qiáng de.
examples.english: That computer is the only one with the strongest performance in the entire showroom.
